isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES - DT/DTI/DTA - 466 C SERIES DIESEL ENGINES - SUFFICIENT CLEAN FUEL DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Engines (With Robert Bosch "MW" or "A" Fuel Injection Pump) - Fuel Quality

svcproc.title: Fuel Quality
svcproc.para: Fuel must be of proper grade, clean, undiluted a free of air.

step1.para: CHECK FOR AIR IN FUEL: Check for leaks in the supply line from the tank to the fuel pump. If in doubt, connect a piece of clear plastic tubing from the filter to the injection pump inlet. Run engine and watch for air bubbles - THERE SHOULD BE NO AIR BUBBLES.

CHECK FOR QUALITY: By-pass the fuel system. Run the engine with a can of fuel known to be of good quality. Observe engine performance. If engine performance is improved with the use of the sample fuel, clean the system and refill with proper, clean fuel.

para.emph: Cold weather can cause fuel waxing of cer - tain grades of diesel fuel which result in fuel filter plugging.

step1.para: For fuel specifications, refer to the appropriate DT/DTI/DTA-466 Operation and Maintenance Manual.
